result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:40 AM Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Joseph Theodore Trepanier.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:59 AM Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier in court, in custody at Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Joseph Theodore Trepanier.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 11:45 am.

11:53 AM Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier appeared by video, in custody.   Attorney Cheryl Gill (Special Appearance) appears by video.   Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Court reviews the motion to modify bond.  Attny Gill inquires about bond covering all cases, Clerk verifies it only covers 22CF101.   Attny Gill makes bond argument.  State opposes bond modification, State indicates spoke to probation agent.  Attny Gill no further argument.  Court denies motion.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing on July 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

11:48 AM Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier appeared by video, in custody from Sawyer County Jail. Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Joseph Theodore Trepanier. Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (21CF155, 21CF223, 22CF101) and recites appearances. Atty Gill indicates DEF will waive preliminary hearing in 22CF101.  Court addresses DEF on waiver and finds waiver is knowledgeable and voluntary.  Atty Gill makes statement on motion to modify bond.  State responds, indicates lack of details and information, objects to modification of bond.  Court questions Atty Gill on providing additional information.  State requests bond motion hearing be reset to provide Atty Gill time to provide additional information.  Court addresses DEF on probation agent, DEF responds.  Atty Gill instructs DEF to stop speaking.  Atty Gill provides name of Probation Agent.  Discussion among all parties on scheduling.  Court sets motion hearing for 7/6/22 at 11:30AM.
Motion hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
